message.content:
We first “extract” the transactions that are recorded as Interest Receivables. In our data the rows with type “Interest Receivables” (with “Unpaid” status) have the following amounts (all in the same currency):

• Interest20240101001:  442.775  
• Interest20240102002:  442.775  
• Interest20240103003:  442.775  
• Interest20240104004:  442.775  
• Interest20240105005:  442.775  
• Interest20240106006:  433.875  
• Interest20240107007:  424.4215802  
• Interest20240108008:  424.4215802  
• Interest20240109009:  376.8065802  
• Interest20240110010:  376.8065802  
• Interest20240111011:  376.8065802  
• Interest20240112012:  376.8065802  
• Interest20240113013:  376.8065802  
• Interest20240114014:  376.8065802  
• Interest20240115015:  373.6915802  
• Interest20240116016:  373.6915802  
• Interest20240117017:  373.6915802  
• Interest20240118018:  373.6915802  
• Interest20240119019:  369.2415802  
• Interest20240120020:  369.2415802  
• Interest20240121021:  366.5715802  
• Interest20240122022:  350.5515802  
• Interest20240123023:  350.5515802  
• Interest20240124024:  350.5515802  
• Interest20240125025:  350.5515802  
• Interest20240126026:  350.5515802  
• Interest20240127027:  350.5515802  
• Interest20240128028:  350.5515802  

We now add these amounts together step‐by‐step:

1. Sum first 5 entries (each 442.775):  
  5 × 442.775 = 2213.875

2. Then add the 6th entry:  
  2213.875 + 433.875 = 2647.75

3. Next, add the 7th and 8th entries (each 424.4215802):  
  424.4215802 × 2 = 848.8431604  
  2647.75 + 848.8431604 = 3496.5931604

4. The next five entries (items 9–13) are each 376.8065802:  
  5 × 376.8065802 = 1884.032901  
  3496.5931604 + 1884.032901 = 5380.6260614

5. Add the 14th entry (another 376.8065802):  
  5380.6260614 + 376.8065802 = 5757.4326416

6. Next, add four entries of 373.6915802 (items 15–18):  
  4 × 373.6915802 = 1494.7663208  
  5757.4326416 + 1494.7663208 = 7252.1989624

7. Then add the two entries of 369.2415802 (items 19–20):  
  2 × 369.2415802 = 738.4831604  
  7252.1989624 + 738.4831604 = 7990.6821228

8. Next add the 21st entry of 366.5715802:  
  7990.6821228 + 366.5715802 = 8357.253703

9. Finally, add the last 7 entries (items 22–28), each 350.5515802:  
  7 × 350.5515802 = 2453.8610614  
  8357.253703 + 2453.8610614 = 10811.1147644

Thus the net amount (the “change” or ending balance increase) in the Interest Receivable account is about 10,811.11.

When preparing the cash flow statement an increase in a current asset (here, interest receivable) results in a “use” of cash (a deduction) – however, the task statement asks for the final interest receivable “item” (i.e. the net change).

Therefore, in the cash flow statement the “(Increase) Decrease in Interest Receivable” would be recorded as an increase of 10811.11. (Often this is shown as a negative adjustment since an increase in receivables means cash was “used,” but here we simply report the net amount.)

Thus, the solution in the required JSON format is:

--------------------------------------------------

{
  "solution": {
    "(Increase) Decrease in Interest Receivable": "10811.11"
  }
}
